body_html:
Regarding this error: "AssertionError: Could not compute output DeferredTensor('None', shape=(5,), dtype=float32)"
The value returned by the compute_output_shape function is flattened which causes it to be interpreted as multiple outputs. I am going to test a fix on the custom layer example above.

As a workaround you could wrap the output shape returned by compute_output_shape in a TensorShape. For example: TensorShape((input_shape[0], self.output_dim)). Let me know if this works.
body_text:
Regarding this error: "AssertionError: Could not compute output DeferredTensor('None', shape=(5,), dtype=float32)"
The value returned by the compute_output_shape function is flattened which causes it to be interpreted as multiple outputs. I am going to test a fix on the custom layer example above.
As a workaround you could wrap the output shape returned by compute_output_shape in a TensorShape.  For example: TensorShape((input_shape[0], self.output_dim)). Let me know if this works.
body:
Regarding this error: "AssertionError: Could not compute output DeferredTensor('None', shape=(5,), dtype=float32)"
The value returned by the compute_output_shape function is flattened which causes it to be interpreted as multiple outputs. I am going to test a fix on the custom layer example above.

As a workaround you could wrap the output shape returned by compute_output_shape in a TensorShape.  For example: TensorShape((input_shape[0], self.output_dim)). Let me know if this works.
